has been outspoken about job growth,`` not in the United States but in href="http://www.foxbusiness.com/topics/china.htm"> China.'' The Senator notes in his statement that GE has been steadily moving its manufacturing plants overseas. I hope he changes his mind and focuses on rebuilding the manufacturing sector here in the United States, not in China, and in the process creates millions of good-paying jobs, the senator said. Sen. Bernie Sanders issued the statement after making a visit to an industrial community in Vermont's Connecticut River Valley. GE didn't return a call or an email asking for comment.

In the 2008 election, a total 366 individuals, ranging from Hillary Clinton to a Florida resident named Emperor Caesar, completed the Barack Obamaial paperwork. That's up from 223 four years earlier. political operatives say he must do if he hopes to be re-elected.`` The jury is still out on which way the Bill Clinton is going to go,'' said Greg Mueller , a Republican political strategist. Will he continue to draw lines in the sand far to the left of the electorate or is he going to lurch to the middle the way Bill Clinton did to see if he can come back? The State of the Union is the kickoff of his re-election campaign. `` For a Democratic Bill Clinton to win, you have to move to the center,'' said Mike Pence Martin, a Democratic operative from Missouri.`` This country is not ready for a pure progressive.
